alert.note: Alert for Butler; Darke; Miami; Montgomery; Preble; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:49AM EDT until April 01 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Franklin County in southeastern Indiana... Southeastern Union County in east central Indiana... Preble County in west central Ohio... Butler County in southwestern Ohio... Western Warren County in southwestern Ohio... Southeastern Darke County in west central Ohio... Montgomery County in west central Ohio... Miami County in west central Ohio... * Until 130 AM EDT. * At 1249 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Greenville to 7 miles northwest of Camden to near Brookville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Dayton, Hamilton, Kettering, Middletown, Fairfield, Huber Heights, Mason, Troy, Trotwood, Oxford, Piqua, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Springboro, Vandalia, Englewood, Greenville, Monroe, Trenton and Franklin. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 3 and 37. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 21 and 26. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 82. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for southeastern and east central Indiana...and southwestern and west central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for southeastern and east central Indiana...and southwestern and west central Ohio.
